subject: RE: [junit] problem with assert equals
msgSnippet: ... That s a good point, but I also want to check to see if the references are to the exact same object otherwise the factory is not doing what it is supposed
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 14, 2002 10:53 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] problem with assert equals
>
>
> So said Durham David Cntr 805CSS/SCBE on 2002-11-14
>
> >I am making an assertion in a test script and it is throwing
> an error.
> I
> >know that the arguments that I am passing into the assertion
> are valid
> >String objects.
> >
> >Here's the error:
> >
> > Caused an ERROR
> >junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/l
> ang/String
> ;)V
> > at
> mil.usaf.rad.course.tests.CourseFactoryTest.testCreateSection(Unknown
> >Source)
> > at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
> > at
> >sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAcces
> sorImpl.ja
> va:39)
> > at
> >sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMet
> hodAccesso
> rImpl.java:25)
> > at
> org.netbeans.core.execution.RunClassThread.run(RunClassThread.
> java:119)
> >
> >
> >Here's the code:
> >
> > public void testCreateSection() throws Exception {
> > Section section = CourseFactory.newSection();
> > section.setCourse(course);
> > section.setName("section");
> > section.setAccountRequired(false);
> > section.save();
> >
> > Section section2 =
> >CourseFactory.getSection(section.getSectionID());
> >
> > //System.err.println("section2 name: " + section2.getName());
> > //System.err.println("section name: " + section.getName());
> >>> assertEquals(section.getName(), section2.getName()); //
> throws
> >the error
> > assertEquals(section.getCourse(), section2.getCourse()); //
> if I
> >comment the line above, then this line will run just fine.
> > assertEquals(section.getAccountRequired(),
> >section2.getAccountRequired());
> > }
> >
> >
> >If I uncomment the System.err lines then I see that both of these
> objects
> >have the name "section" which is what I want, but for some reason the
> call
> >to assertEquals will throw the error above.
> >
> >Does anyone know what would or could be causing this?
>
> I don't, but I have another suggestion once you get past that problem:
> consider implementing equals() and hashCode() on "Section" and just
> checking
>
> assertEquals(section, section2);
>
> The tests become less brittle and easier to read. :)
>


That's a good point, but I also want to check to see if the references are to the exact same object otherwise the factory is not
doing what it is supposed to do. It does get worse as more methods are added to the testing so I've been using reflection to loop through them.

Got any ideas on this?
